docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Clue Chasers is a Discord server with the largest collection of RS3 Clue related content.

discordInvite.init({ inviteCode: 'cluechasers', title: 'PVME', }); discordInvite.render();
  • This website has all the same information and is updated daily.
  • It's a copy of PvME edited to fit Clue Chasers.

docs.title: Motivation
docs.text:
• Make the Clue Chasers content available outside of Discord.
  • Improve navigation through a powerful search and an always-visible table of contents.
  • Fast and lightweight thanks to Mkdocs material.
Last updated: Sep 19, 2023

• F , S , / : open search dialog

docs.title: How The Site Works
docs.text:
Full process on Github, and in short:

  1. Gather the .txt files from the clue chasers master repository.
  2. Format .txt -> .md.
  3. Build the website from the .md files using MKDocs Material.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
First and foremost, the information on the website are always up-to-date with the Clue Chasers Discord Server.

This is because both are using the .txt guides from the clue chasers master repository.

I try to stay ahead of this by adding formatting rules that exclude or change Discord-only content.

If you find any formatting issues, please message either (Pleb#0025) / (Saltea#5509) on Discord or create an issue on Github.

docs.title: Alt1 FAQ
docs.text:
What is Alt1? (https://runeapps.org/alt1)

Alt1 is a RuneApps third-party program. It reads your Runescape client to function.

With this it assists you with many things such as afking, skilling, pvming and of course clues!

It will help you solve clues by telling you where your current step is and it will also tell you where to click to solve your puzzles.

​

Is there any other benefit to Alt1?

Absolutely. Alt1 is an open-sourced project which allows you to create your own apps within it's parameters.

​

Is Alt1 allowed?

JMOD Response here (https://i.imgur.com/VSOXy5R.png)

TL;DR of JMod Response: Yes, it is allowed. Just be careful what you do with it.

​

Alt1 isn't working?

Usually this is user-error.

For this we recommend you go to the official RuneApps discord: https://discord.com/invite/G3SbcS8

You can also ask in Clue Chasers #help channel.

​

How to use Alt1 for arrow/compass clues

https://youtu.be/mMgaFy5uD7g

​

How to install an extra app to Alt1

⬥ Install by copying the link into your browser

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• alt1://addapp/https://user.github.io/app.json

⬥ Or, by going to the link in the Alt1 Browser

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• https://user.github.io/app/

​

Alt1 for MacOS and Linux

For MacOS and Linux you would use Runekit, it's the same thing just modified to work for the operating systems.

https://github.com/whs/runekit

​

docs.title: Helpful Alt1 Apps
docs.text:
⬥ Scripture of Bik Catalyst Tracker; this tracks the amount of clues you've gotten through the Scripture of Bik.

⬥ Scripture of Bik Proc Timer; this tells you when to do an action that can give a book proc.

⬥ Clue Completion Timer; this times how long it's taken you to solve your clues. (similar to LiveSplit)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• https://github.com/yongyi781/clue-split

⬥ Clue Reward Tracker; this tracks and logs your rewards whilst opening caskets.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• https://runeapps.org/forums/viewtopic.php?pid=4751#p4751

docs.title: Croesus Front Gathering
docs.text: (courtesy of #Saltea)

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Scripture of Bik is a very good way to gather clues of all types. It averages 10 procs an hour assuming 60 proc chances an hour.

​

⬥ An hour of Scripture of Bik averages:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Easy clues: 1.1

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Medium clues: 5.2

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hard clues: 4.3

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elite clues: 4.7

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Master clues: 0.17

​

Croesus Front Skilling is good for gathering clues as you can get a Elder Trove (Bik) every 6 minutes whilst skilling. This will often give you a lot of your Manuscripts of Bik back. This is good because Manuscripts of Bik are expensive. Scripture of Bik costs 7,538,349 an hour to use.

​

This method aims to either break even or profit whilst using Scripture of Bik .

​

docs.title: Useful Items and Information
docs.text:
⬥ Pontifex Shadow Ring fully upgraded

⬥ You can take whatever items you want to proc Scripture of Bik as long as they stack

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For example if you are wanting 120 Fletching, take Arrow tips and arrowshafts with Portable Fletchers

⬥ It is highly recommended staying away from the Mining section as it takes quite a long time to mine for a Elder Trove (Bik)

⬥ It is recommended to use a timer for when you can gather another Elder Trove (Bik)

⬥ Elder Trove (Bik) are 3,713,335 profit an hour alone

​

docs.title: Easy Gathering
docs.text: (courtesy of #Saltea)

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Easy clues are very fast to gather and solve. They have a master clue scroll rate of 3/100 and have a Fortunate component rate of 21/100, note that this rate does include re-rolls and tier 4 luck .

​

The meta for gathering easy clues is to pickpocket the H.A.M. members. You can pickpocket an average of 85 (86.1 with Scripture of Bik ) easy clues an hour. Keep in mind that the soft cap still applies, you would have to pickpocket until you have 25 / 50 and then go solve them.

​

Each Easy clue casket is worth 657,000. Advanced cluers can gather and solve up to 44+ easy clues an hour putting them at 28,925,091+ an hour.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
⬥ Lost Her Marbles miniquest

⬥ 20 Thieving

​

docs.title: Useful Items and Information
docs.text:
⬥ Full Camouflage outfit

⬥ Thieving Skillcape

⬥ Exoskeleton outfit (unlocked)

⬥ Ardougne Cloak 3 (unlocked)

⬥ Sticky Fingers relic (if afking)

​

⬥ It is not recommended to do this method until you have a higher Thieving level.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The higher your Thieving level the less likely you are to fail a pickpocket.

⬥ If you spam click pickpocket you can still receive receive easy clues even when your inventory is full.

​

docs.title: Preset
docs.text:
⬥ Put the highest valued items in the preset to make sure they never go to the floor.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you're afking; empty the inventory other than the Charos' clue carrier.

docs.title: Gathering
docs.text:
⬥ It is recommended to use one-button gameplay so you can spam left click.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can also re-map your scroll wheel to left click.

⬥ If you are afking, put the items you wish to drop on your action bar to drop them quickly.

⬥ Try to trap a H.A.M. Member like so.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can zoom in and spam click the bottom of the H.A.M. member.

docs.title: Elite Abyssal Beasts
docs.text: (courtesy of #Saltea and #rly alan)

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Elite clues are slow to gather and solve. They have the highest master clue scroll per clue at 26/100 and have a Fortunate component rate of 44/100, note that this rate does include re-rolls and tier 4 luck .

​

The meta for gathering elite clues is to kill Abyssal Beasts. You can gather an average of 11+ (16+ with Scripture of Bik ) elite clues an hour. Keep in mind that the soft cap still applies, you would have to gather until you have 25 / 50 and then go solve them.

​

Each Elite clue casket is worth 3,984,000 (-1,932,001 with Puzzle skips ). Advanced cluers can gather and solve up to 10.77+ (11.86+ with Puzzle skips ) elite clues an hour putting them at 42,907,471+ (-22,913,530 with Puzzle skips ) an hour.

docs.title: Elite Clue Guide (2)
docs.text: Elite Clue Guide (courtesy of #Unknown user DominusJuris, Phyzzix4PF) (not sure who wants tagging)

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Elite clues are the second highest tier clue scroll consisting of Compass and Scan steps with potential Knot and Slider puzzles. An elite clue can be between 5 to 7 steps long (4 to 6 with the Toten of Treasure).

​

Each Elite Casket is worth: (Could these value be auto updated based on prices set elsewhere?)

~ 4,690,000 gp (without skipping tickets)

~ 4,210,321 gp (using only Knot skipping tickets)

~ -1,268,909 gp (using both Knot and Puzzle skipping tickets)

​

You should aim to be doing up towards 20 elite clues an hour (without skipping tickets) once you have the correct set up and methods in place.

​

It is highly recommended to do the following before starting elite clues:

⬥ Learn how to use Alt1 effectively for Compass steps

⬥ Familiarise yourself with how scan clues work: Pulse speed and sound, Meerkat range, Recommended scan routes

​

docs.title: Recommended requirements for OPTIMAL Elite clue solving
docs.text:
Area tasks

Hard Tirannwn (teleport to the Elf Camp and no trap fails)

Elite Desert (Desert Amulet 4: Nardah + Uzer teleport)

Elite Fremmy (Enchanted Lyre + ‎ ‎Neitiznot and Jatizso on Enchanted Lyre)

​

Skills

112 Archaeology (can be boosted)

​

Quests

Evil Dave’s Big Day Out (Dave’s Spellbook)

Fur ‘n’ Seek + Rag and Bone Man Wish List (unlocks Skeletal Horror teleport)

Darkness of Hallowvale (Burgh de Rott teleport on Games Necklace)

Desperate Times (Charos’ Clue Carrier)

Dream Mentor (access to Spellbook Swap)

King of the Dwarves (for access to the Lava Flow Mine)

The Dig Site + find clean necklace in the Varrock Museum (unlocks Dig Site Pendant)

Jack of Trades (unlocks Menaphos so you can relocate your house there)

Ghost ahoy (unlocks Ectophial)

​

Totem of Treasure

Sceptre of the Gods

Repair the CJS Fairy Ring

Unlock Ancient Invention

Nature's Sentinel Outfit (several best in slot teleports + essential Neitiznot and Jatizso teleport)

Plant Spirit Tree at Port Sarim and Brimhaven

Dark Facet of Luck

Notes, Tips, and tricks

Use Lunar Spellbook with Spellbook Swap for teleports

Compass Traingulation: Moonclan (Lunars) + South Feldip Hills (Standard). A Spirit Tree is located at Feldip Hills if needed.

Disassemble Dorgesh-kaan teleport spheres for Bik procs

Dragon trinkets can be used for Brutal Greens Dragons (compass), Blue Dragons (Taverly Scan), Red Dragons (Brimhaven Scan), Black Dragons (Zanaris Scan)

Slayer mask priority - Aquanite > Kurask > Basilisk

Pollnivneach Chipped House tablets and Slayer Mask can be replaced with Skip Tickets if preferred

Activating Jacket on a Wilderness Crater scan will show the Wilderness Level, giving you a better idea of which spot it may be

Use HSR/LotD/Amulet of Glory to teleport out of Level 20-30 Wilderness

NE Daemonheim spot - Either use ED2 tablet + Chest teleport to ED3 OR have an ED3 Reaper Task and use the reaper portal

If looking to save Sentinel charges, you can modify the chipped House teleports on the fly for spots west of Rimmington - Modify → 1 → 3. Revert back when needed.

If out of Sentinel charges - Replace with Master Archaeology outfit and exchange Archaeology Teleports for Big Book o'Piracy. Jacket Fremennik Isles and do Mos Le'Harmless scan.

Use Lantadyme incense sticks to extend Spirit Attraction Potion timer and drink 1 dose prior to starting the run.

Use Spiritual Healing after summoning meerkat to extend the timer

docs.title: Optimal Elite Clue  Requirements
docs.text:
These are the requirements to complete each and every step optimally.

Note: Elite clues have no requirements, you cannot get a step you cannot do.

docs.title: Elite Shadow Creatures
docs.text: (courtesy of #Saltea)

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Elite clues are slow to gather and solve. They have the highest master clue scroll per clue at 26/100 and have a Fortunate component rate of 44/100, note that this rate does include re-rolls and tier 4 luck .

​

Shadow Creatures are a good way to gather elite clues if you don't have the Slayer level for Abyssal Beasts. You can gather an average of 7.8+ (12.5+ with Scripture of Bik ) elite clues an hour. Keep in mind that the soft cap still applies, you would have to gather until you have 25 / 50 and then go solve them.

​

Each Elite clue casket is worth 3,984,000 (-1,932,001 with Puzzle skips ). Advanced cluers can gather and solve up to 10.77+ (11.86+ with Puzzle skips ) elite clues an hour putting them at 42,907,471+ (-22,913,530 with Puzzle skips ) an hour.

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Elite clues are slow to gather and solve. They have the highest master clue scroll per clue at 26/100 and have a Fortunate component rate of 44/100, note that this rate does include re-rolls and tier 4 luck .

​

Abyssal Lords and Abyssal Beasts are good for gathering elite clues via crystal triskelion key fragments and actual clue drops.

docs.title: Not getting clues?
docs.text:
⬥ Make sure you haven't unticked any of the options in:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Settings → Gameplay → Item Drops → Clue scrolls

⬥ Clue scrolls have a cap of 25 clues by default. 50 after clue capacity upgrade.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Check your bank, inventory, clue carrier and Elite Dungeon 4 chest.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The cap is based on the sum of each clue tier separately. Unfinished clues count towards the cap.

⬥ If you are pickpocketing H.A.M. members, make sure you have you completed "Lost Her Marbles (miniquest)".

docs.title: Soft cap
docs.text:
The soft cap is a limit placed on items to stop you bypassing getting certain items past a quantity limit in a specific method. There is no hard cap on the amount of clues you can collect you just cannot get more than 25 or 50 after clue capacity upgrade via a drop.

Ways to bypass soft cap:

⬥ Prosper Perk

⬥ Fire Spirits

⬥ Quests

⬥ Skeleton Horror

⬥ Crystal triskelions

⬥ Tetracompass

⬥ Player Owned House Aquarium Weekly Chest

⬥ Downgrading Higher Tiered Clues at Zaida

⬥ Buying Clues with extra Treasure Trail Points from Zaida

⬥ Box of clues

⬥ Scripture of Bik

⬥ Harvesting a Sacred yak

If a gathering method is not in this list, you cannot get clues past 25 / 50 of each tier doing it.

docs.title: Making Alchemical Jewellery
docs.text:
To make Alchemical Jewellery you need at least:

⬥ Cut Onyx

⬥ 5,000 Junk components

⬥ 50 Fortunate components

⬥ 10 Precious components

⬥ 2.5 Junk refiners

You then use the Junk refiners to make 50 Refined components

With this you can now make an Alchemical Onyx

For an Alchemical Hydrix you will need a Cut Hydrix and 2 Rumbling components

Go to an Invention Workbench and click Misc to make them.

docs.title: Movement Abilities
docs.text:
Bladed Dive works by drawing a small rectangle that includes you and your target title with a maximum width and length of 11 tiles. Each tile is evaluated separately. Each evaluation has 3 possible directions, each with a fixed order.

They are:

⬥ Move towards the target tile diagonally. Only if diagonal walk is permitted.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• (E.g. in an attempt to move 1 tile north-east, you actually move 1 tile east, then north due to a wall = doesn't count.)

⬥ Move towards the target tile on X-axis.

⬥ Move towards the target tile on Y-axis.

As soon as a viable direction is found, move to the tile. Start the search again from the top of the list. If you end up on the selected tile, bladed dive destination is granted. If all 3 checks fail at any point before target tile, you will receive error message: "You can't dive through something you can't walk through!"

When you ask to move beyond 11 tiles, you will not get the error message. The ability is always used and you are placed as far as the algorithm can take. Including no actual movement; you may be moved to a tile you are already at.

To easily see where blocked tiles and walls exist, use Mej's map with "Areas (inverted)" turned on: https://mejrs.github.io/?layer=Areas+%28inverted%29

docs.title: Are skipping Tickets worth it?
docs.text:
From a financial point of view, most skipping tickets are not worth using for most people. It is up to you how much you value your other goals, such as log completion, and whether you think those other goals bear enough weight to make skipping tickets worth using.

Check this spreadsheet to see at how much you need to value your time in order to justify using certain skips, purely from a financial point of view: https://shorturl.at/mvM49

Costume skipping tickets are not included cause they have a lot of use until you get the full globetrotter outfit, and no use at all after that.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Hard clues are fast to gather and solve. They have a master clue scroll rate of 9/100 and have a high Fortunate component rate of 57/100, note that this rate does include re-rolls and tier 4 luck .

​

The meta for gathering hard clues is to kill Glayctes. You can gather an average of 44 (48.3 with Scripture of Bik ) hard clues an hour. Keep in mind that the soft cap still applies, you would have to gather until you have 25 / 50 and then go solve them.

Each Hard clue casket is worth 2,052,000 (277,322 with Puzzle skips ). Advanced cluers can gather and solve up to 24.82+ (28.02+ with Puzzle skips ) hard clues an hour putting them at 50,931,087+ (7,770,572 with Puzzle skips ) an hour.

docs.title: Read Me
docs.text:
The Information Hub is designed to centralize and organize information through four channels and their corresponding forums: #unknown-channel #unknown-channel ⁠#unknown-channel ⁠#unknown-channel

​

These channels serve as navigation pages to access the available forums. Instead of manually searching through the forums, it is recommended to use these index pages to find the specific forum post you are looking for.

​

For instance, if you are seeking the solving preset for hard clues, you would navigate to the ⁠#unknown-channel channel. Within this channel, you can select a link that will automatically open the forum post containing the desired information. At the end of each forum post, there is also a returning link back to each index page.

​

Although it may require some adjustment, this system ensures that the server maintains centralized, up-to-date, and well-maintained information for easy access.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Unlike OSRS which has the RuneLite client, RS3 only has its NXT client. In order to add some extra QoL/features, the Alt1 Toolkit was developed by #Unknown user. This channel serves as a brief overview about Alt1 and what it's used for in regards to Clue Scrolls with some extra helpful add-ons/plugins developed for it.

Alt1 Download You can download Alt1 from the official RuneApps website. For Alt1 support/queries, please visit the RuneApps discord. You can also check out the RuneApps forums.

If you have any issues with regard to Alt1, please use the dedicated RuneApps discord server that has a section for player support.

​

docs.title: Alt1 Overview
docs.text:
⬥ Alt1 is a 3rd-party program that consists of several application overlays on your screen.

⬥ They get information by reading your screen, and provide a bunch of QoL/useful features.

​

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
⬥ Alt1 is designed to capture images of the NXT Client and parse them with an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) Library.

⬥ The captured data is then transformed into pixel data that can be used in Alt1 apps.

⬥ More information can be found on the forums and in the Alt1 Toolkit discord.

​

docs.title: Is It Safe?
docs.text:
⬥ Alt1 is essentially a glorified Chromium browser that creates overlays over your game. Every Alt1 app is essentially a webpage.

⬥ Alt1 does not send any inputs or otherwise directly interact with your client beyond reading the pixels on the screen.

⬥ It is not a client, therefore you won't get banned for using it. https://www.reddit.com/r/runescape/comments/3ovux7/the_alt1_toolkit_has_been_reviewed_by_jagex_and/

​

docs.title: Clue Solver
docs.text:
⬥ This is a very useful app that looks at your currently open clue on screen, and tells you how to solve it.

⬥ It handles every type of clue except for scans which are explained through the #unknown-channel

⬥ Have your clue visible on-screen clearly and click the 'Unlock Any' button to find a solution to your clue that will be displayed on the overlay.

docs.title: 3rd-Party Alt1 Apps
docs.text:
In addition to the default apps that come with Alt1, there are a number of other useful third-party apps that can be installed.

​

⬥ Alt1 Addons can be installed by going to the correct URL in either your normal browser or the Alt1 in-built browser.

⬥ This will bring up a prompt to add the application to Alt1.

⬥ The list of apps below have the full URL following each one.

⬥ Note that none of these links will work on mobile, as they require Alt1 to be installed.

​

docs.title: Linux and macOS Support
docs.text:
Whilst there is no official Alt1 Support for these operating systems there's an alternative which can be found at https://github.com/whs/runekit

​

docs.title: Scan Trainer - alt1://addapp/<https://leridon.github.io/cluetrainer-live/appconfig.json>
docs.text:
Explanation - guides players through efficiently solving scan steps in elite and master clues see #unknown-channel https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/1101214731571822673/1128424402111963156/image.png?width=878&height=463

​

docs.title: Bik Book Timer - alt1://addapp/<https://amerryma.github.io/alt1-bik-proc-timer/appconfig.json>
docs.text:
Explanation - alerts when to disassemble with Bik book

Important Notes - Both in-game time stamps and the app above use your local machine time. For most people it's off from RuneScape's internal server time by +/- 2 seconds.

⬥ This bit of information only matters when flicking the book. For more information on Bik: #unknown-channel

⬥ The few seconds can be corrected like this: https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/400499160094212097/965589572354441216/Sync.mp4

docs.title: Amulet Of Nature
docs.text:
To bind the amulet of nature the player must use the amulet on the diseased patch they desire but this can only be bound to one patch at a time, and will remain bound until a different patch is used. Unlike the amulet of farming, it can be bound to any type of farming patch.

​

Note that the amulet of nature gets bound to the tile you are standing on when using the amulet on the the diseased patch.

docs.title: Dark Facet Of Luck
docs.text:
Dark Facet of Luck is an enchantment that gives additional benefits to tier 4 luck enhancers,

such as the Luck of the Dwarves and Hazelmere's signet ring When the player is wearing a

tier 4 luck enhancer or harnessing the Luck of the Dwarves relic power , the enchantment offers:

​

A 1% chance to skip a clue step on completion of a clue step.

When the ring shines to skip a clue step, the following message appears in the chat box:

The Dark Facet of Luck used Forbidden knowledge to allow you to skip a clue step.

​

0.1% chance to gain two caskets on completion of a clue scroll.

When the ring shines to double a casket, the player will receive a pop-up chatbox stating: You've found a casket! The Dark Facet of Luck forms a second casket in its shadow. A message stating that the player received 2x caskets will also appear in the unfiltered game chat.

​

Additional teleport to the Dwarven Outpost, only when the player is using the equipment.

The effects of the enchantment are permanently applied to the player once used.

​

​

docs.title: Soft Cap
docs.text:
A soft cap is a type of limit placed on a quantity of something in RuneScape. Unlike a hard cap, which places an unavoidable limit on the quantity, soft caps allow players to go over defined limits, but with extra restrictions placed on the excess. The restriction placed varies based on the applied soft cap.

​

Clue scrolls: there is a soft cap of 25 (50 with the clue capacity upgrade) clues per clue difficulty, except for sealed master clue scrolls, which have no cap. However, players can receive over 25 clues of a certain difficulty if that clue scroll is received from a guaranteed source, such as the treasure chest decoration guaranteeing a sealed elite clue scroll each time it is opened. Additionally, the Prosper perk allows players to obtain clue scrolls above the cap, and clue scrolls obtained from harvesting a Sacred yak bypass the cap.

​

Ways to bypass soft cap:

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Prosper Perk

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fire Spirits

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Quests

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Skeleton Horror

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Crystal triskelions

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tetracompass

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• POH Aquarium Weekly Chest

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Downgrading Higher Tiered Clues at Zaida

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Buying Clues with extra TT Points from Zaida

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Box of clues

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Scripture of Bik

docs.title: ### Introduction
docs.text:
This page is aimed to assist players who are embarking on their clue scroll journey and looking to grasp the fundamentals. It covers various topics and provides additional information in it's own section. If you are already familiar with these concepts or your main focus is exploring a particular clue tier, you can easily navigate to the bottom of the page for quick access.

​

We welcome any suggestions for improving this guide; please share your ideas with us in the #unknown-channel channel.

Should you require advice or have any questions, don't hesitate to make use of the #unknown-channel channel.

docs.title: ### General Concept
docs.text:
Treasure Trails is a members-only Distraction and Diversion in which players follow a series of clues leading towards buried treasure.

A Treasure Trail is started by finding a sealed clue scroll, which may be dropped by various monsters, pickpocketed from H.A.M. Members and elven clan workers, received from a treasure chest decoration in an aquarium, killing the skeletal horror, purchased with thaler, obtained from the Prosper perk, training gathering skills or collecting catalysts of alteration. The chances of receiing a clue scroll increase with the appropriate tier luck enhancer.

As of the clue scroll overhaul on 26 February 2018, players can collect as many as 25 clue scrolls of each type of difficulty below master, subject to a soft cap. This can be increased to 50 of each type with 750 Treasure Trail Points at the Treasure Trails Reward Shop. The caps count both sealed and active clue scrolls.

Master clues are unlimited. Originally, players could only have one clue scroll at a time (and reward caskets ) which was later changed to one of all difficulties, and now in its current state. This soft cap can be partially bypassed, such as guaranteed or item holding services. Once the player hits the soft cap however, players cannot obtain any more clue scrolls, outside of guaranteed sources. | | | etc.

Only one of each type of sealed clue scroll can be open at a time. Attempting to open a sealed clue scroll if a player already owns an open one will result in the following text in the chat window: You already have an active easy/medium/hard/elite treasure trail. You'll need to either complete or destroy that before starting another.

Most unique rewards can be placed in the treasure chest in the costume room of a player-owned house. After completing a Treasure Trail, a message comes up in the chat box indicating how many Treasure Trails have been completed of that difficulty: " Congratulations! You have now completed [amount] [difficulty] treasure trails." The next line tells how many Treasure Trail Points have been obtained: " You earn [amount] treasure trails points. You now have [amount] points."

South-west of the Grand exchange's southern gate, a treasure trail expert named Zaida has set up the Treasure Trails Reward Shop with her pack yak, Nigel. Besides offering assistance and information to fellow treasure seekers, she maintains a Treasure Trail information board. There is also a stack of Treasure Trail collection log books behind her for players to use.

docs.title: ### Difficulty
docs.text:
The "level" or "tier" of a clue scroll relates to its difficulty. There are five levels of clue scrolls: easy , medium , hard , elite and master.

An easy clue is the lowest difficulty treasure trail, with the lowest reward yield. Medium clue scrolls are a medium difficulty treasure trail with a more substantial reward yield. Hard clue scrolls are a more hazardous treasure trail, but can be very rewarding. Elite clue scrolls are much harder to obtain and can be very dangerous (both to receive and to complete). Master clue scrolls have the greatest difficulties in obtaining and the highest requirements for completing, but offer the greatest rewards and are generally considered to be significantly easier than elites.

​

As monster drops, clue scrolls are always considered "tertiary" (bonus drop); luck can affect the chances of one rolling. When received, a loot beam will always appear and a game message will tell the player of the drop. As skilling drops, clue scrolls can be obtained at random and a game message will inform the player whenever they obtain one.

​

If the player cannot complete the clue, then it is recommended to exchange it for another with the Globetrotter backpack (if available), or destroy it. Some clues (notably emote clues) may also be skipped with a Skipping ticket , although this may not be cost-effective. Zaida can also exchange the clue scroll for a lower difficulty if needed, though she will not convert any easy clue scrolls as they are the lowest tier.

​

Sealed clue scrolls can also be obtained by training gathering skills. Skills that can yield clues are Archaeology , Divination (1/2,500 chance), Fishing (1/3,000 chance), Mining (1/2,250 chance), and Woodcutting (1/3,000 chance).

The tier of clue scroll players receive is weighted based on their level of the activity, with elites appearing at level 60 training methods and above.

docs.title: Tips & Tricks
docs.text:
In-game sounds are able to assist with scans. Listening to the pulse instead of staring at your feet allows you focus on surroundings and get information as you are teleporting from one place to another.

​

⬥ Use Totem of Summoning on Anachronia for an extended meerkat timer

⬥ You can right click → modify tabs as you see fit to teleport to other house portals

⬥ Activating the globetrotter jacket during a Wilderness Crater scan will show you the level it is at, narrowing down your search route

⬥ For the North Eastern Daemonheim spot - Either use Dragonkin Laboratory Tokens and teleport to The Shadow Reef or set your War's Retreat portal to The Shadow Reef

⬥ Disassemble Dorgeshkaan Spheres (stackable and cheap) with Scripture of Bik equipped to receive Catalyst of Alteration procs

⬥ Use Lantadyme Incense sticks to extend your Spirit Attraction Potion timer from 6 to 8 minutes.

⬥ If you run out of Nature Sentinel charges, swap to the BIS Preset (No Sentinel)

⬥ For the "No Sceptre of the Gods w/o Skips" preset, use and run the Lumbridge Swamp Cave scan in the dark if you have too.

Shoutouts � Thank you to #Unknown user and #Unknown user for providing the presets

docs.title: Scan Trainer
docs.text:
Scan Trainer (courtesy of #Unknown user)

To get started quickly, jump into Scan Trainer by visiting https://leridon.github.io/cluetrainer-live/

None ​

Introduction

This tool is being developed by #Unknown user.

Being fast at solving scan clues is extremely important to get good and fast at solving elite and also master clues. Nothing slows you down more than aimlessly running around the scan area waiting for the clue to tell you where to go.

​

Efficient scan routes, such as the ones by Fiery (#unknown-channel), utilise the three different kinds of scan pulses (see #unknown-channel) as well as the (sometimes unintuitive) situations where the clue scroll tells you to try scanning a different level to quickly narrow down the remaining candidates. Learning those routes can be frustrating, since movement needs to be followed precisely for it to work and being off by only 1 tile can result in you wondering where you missed the spot.

​

This is where Scan Trainer comes in: Scan Trainer tells you precisely what to do and how to do it, to help you understand and memorize pathing easily and without getting frustrated. It can be added as a plugin to Alt1 and used while solving clues to seamlessly learn without having to study and memorize a spreadsheet. It accurately highlights where to stand on an interactive RuneScape map to easily locate the correct spot ingame.

​

Getting Started/FAQ/Common Issues

A list of the most common problems starting out.

​

⬥ How do I add it to Alt1?

Open alt1://addapp/<https://leridon.github.io/cluetrainer-live/appconfig.json> in your browser to get a prompt whethere you want to add the tool to Alt1 or visit https://leridon.github.io/cluetrainer-live/ in Alt1's browser to get a prompt.

​

⬥ Can it automatically read clues like the clue solver?

Yes! If you have Scan Trainer added to Alt1, enable auto reading by activating the lock button right next to the search field.

None ​

⬥ What do I do after going to step C? Why are there no more instructions?

Have you tried clicking the buttons that say "Single", "Double", etc.? You need to tell the tool what kind of pulse you observe to advance the instructions to the next step, since it can't automatically read it from the game (yet?).

None ​

You can also click the underlined links to advance up to two steps at once if you prefer.

Alternatively, when the instruction just tells you to check a set of spots, it means that there are no more instructions left and you are on your own. This is usually the case for spots you should use a jacket or backpack charge for or for spots that are very close to each other.

​

Scan Trainer is still in beta

Even though scan trainer is quite mature and has most scan clues included, for the time being it is still considered a beta version.

The beta label is meant to communicate that there are still features and content missing and will be removed as soon as that's no longer the case.

​

Giving Feedback

Visit #unknown-channel to leave praise and criticism, report issues, get support, or just say hi and join the discussion about the tool. Any kind of input is very appreciated and helps shaping the future of Scan Trainer and related tools.

​

You can also sign up for the Scan Trainer role at to get notified about new updates.

​

Attention theorycrafter

Scan trainer also includes development tools that are used internally to define the routes and can be used to theorycraft new scan routes. Check it out by opening scan trainer in a browser, select a scan clue and click the edit icon in the top right corner of the map.

​

Return to #unknown-channel

docs.title: Step By Step Elite Clue Guide
Step By Step Easy Clue Guide
Step By Step Hard Clue Guide
Step By Step Medium Clue Guide
Trimmed Completionist Cape Requirement Guide (Courtesy of #Unknown user)
### Introduction
docs.text:
This guide is designed for experienced players aiming to acquire the complete Globetrotter outfit. It assumes that you have already completed all the necessary quests and achievement diaries. Specific sections offer supplementary information to aid you further. However, if your primary goal is to optimize presets, you can find semi-advanced presets for Hards, Elites, and Masters towards the end of this guide. These presets may incur some additional costs compared to a Beginner preset, but not the maximum cost (e.g., using 1 Passage of the Abyss instead of 2).

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ For a comprehensive overview on clues, you can refer to #unknown-channel.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ If you wish to compare the cost analysis of using skips versus not using skips, utilize the command !casket in #unknown-channel.

We welcome any suggestions for improving this guide; please share your ideas with us in the #unknown-channel channel.

Should you require advice or have any questions, don't hesitate to make use of the #unknown-channel channel.

​

​

To efficiently accumulate Treasure Trail points for the full Globetrotter , you will need to complete the following number of clues:

​

1000 Hard Clues

750 Hard Clues + 69 Master Clues

500 Hard Clues + 120 Elite Clues + 74 Master Clues

500 Elite Clues

350 Elite Clues + 93 Master Clues

​

*Note: The Master clue numbers assume the average drop rate of from reward caskets.

If you already have Master clues, prioritize completing those first. Then, use the Treasure Trail point calculator to determine the remaining points required.

​

docs.title: Should you consider a specific Clue tier or not?
docs.text:
⬥ Easy clue scrolls offer very little Treasure Trail points and are not worth doing to obtain the outfit.

⬥ Medium clue scrolls require the Way of the Foot Shaped Key reward to be efficient and this is not worth purchasing prior to the outfit.

⬥ Master clue scrolls are an incredible source of Treasure Trail points and should be done as much as possible due to their speed vs reward point potential.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can use costume skipping tickets to bypass the need for hard-to-obtain items.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The average Master reward greatly outweighs the cost of a Costume Skipping Ticket .

​

docs.title: > What is the quickest method?
docs.text:
⬥ The outcome largely hinges on your speed in solving each clue tier.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can determine your points per hour for each tier, considering your own solving pace, using this sheet: #unknown-channel.

​

⬥Please take note: The Master drop rate (after re-rolls) from Hard clues is 1/11.25, and from Elite clues, it's 1/3.75.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• So, while Hard clues might appear to yield better points per hour compared to Elites, be sure to factor in the number of Masters you obtain as well.

​

Master Notes ⬥ Use Cooking Guild to grab Wild Pie and then cook it ⬥ Make sure to set your  Dwarven Fish Extractor to Resource Mode ⬥ Set your  Max Guild teleport outside ⬥ It would be a good idea to gather some items before hand such as Curly Roots, Raw Wild Pies, Black Dragon Leather, Decorated Cooking Urns (nr), and Zamorak / Saradomin Brew creation sets ⬥ Make sure to have Totem of Treasure active  ⬥ Always use Meerkat Pouch with Scrolls   ⬥ For steps to use  jacket and  backpack charges on, check the preset here: #unknown-channel Table of Contents ⬥ Introduction ⬥ Clue Tiers ⬥ Quick Tiers ⬥ Globetrotter Order ⬥ Gathering ⬥ Hard Clues ⬥ Elite Clues ⬥ Master Clues ⬥ Return to #unknown-channel

docs.title: Rules And Info
docs.text: Welcome to Clue Chasers We advise you to read this message and familiarize yourself with our rules. For concerns utilize #unknown-channel and we can help take care of the situation.  Rule 1 Zero tolerance for illegal or malicious behavior, including attacks, discrimination, threats, criminal discussions, harassment, racist/sexist remarks, excessive spam, dogpiling, and hostile targeting specific users. Rule 2 Inappropriate/explicit content (sexual, racist, discriminatory etc.) will be removed and can be met with moderation actions. These include all types of media (picture/video/link/emotes/stickers), discord avatars and discussions of extreme obscenity. Rule 3 Do not discuss means of breaking Runescape rules, such as means of botting/RWT, scamming/luring, and abuse of gamebreaking bugs. Instead go report in the official RuneScape discord #unknown-channel. Rule 4 Conducting any form of player-to-player trading is strictly prohibted. Use the official RuneScape discord marketplace. #unknown-channel.  If you are approached in your DMs, please create a ticket in ⁠#unknown-channel as soon as possible. Trading offers in DMs to our members is seen as trying to circumvent this rule. Rule 5 Unnecessary spamming a channel or pinging a person will result in a temporary mute. It is advised to use #unknown-channel to not flood ⁠#unknown-channel. Rule 6 Refrain from unnecessarily contacting Jagex Moderators for in-game issues. Use the in-game report feature and social media channels instead. Rule 7 Advertising services or servers is not allowed, except for affiliated communities in the affiliates channel. You can advertise RuneScape-related socials in #unknown-channel. Rule 8 Don't impersonate others by changing your discord name, nickname, or profile picture to match someone else's exactly. Rule 9 For transparency and freely voicing opinions, server suggestions on how the server should be moderated should be brought up in #unknown-channel Any suggestions made elsewhere are likely to be ignored as they become impossible for staff members to meaningfully follow up on. Rule 10 Keep the atmosphere of the chats in mind. Inflammatory remarks, baiting reactions and other comments that disrupt the atmosphere in an unpleasant way are not welcome and and may lead to moderation actions. Rule 11 Contacting or harassing any staff member to circumvent temporary time-outs/moderation actions will result in an extended time-out or permanent ban from this server if deemed necessary. Rule 12 The rules are not exhaustive or set in stone. The staff can take immediate action when needed and will discuss these later for transparency. Staff members are obligated to go discuss appropriate moderation actions and decisions are made together to be fair and avoid bias.  All rulebreaking cases are dealt with individually, considering the circumstances and your server history. These rules also apply to the Voice Channels and Clue Chasers FC.  Clue Chasers Moderation Team Staff ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user Moderators ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user ⬥ #Unknown user
